p:
COVID-19 is a new respiratory illness in humans that affects the lungs and the airways ( 1). It is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ( 2). In late December, 2019, an outbreak of COVID-19 was reported in Wuhan, China ( 3). Despite early warning about its contagious nature, SARS-CoV-2 has now spread across the globe ( 4), infecting more than two million people and claiming more than 243,000 lives (on 2 May 2020)
1 On 11 March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO), declared COVID-19 as a pandemic
2 , which is defined as the worldwide spread of new disease with major public health implications. There are some reports that the original outbreak predated December 2019 and there is emerging evidence to support this assertion.
